thread.title: City to begin planting cherry trees in Ballard Park
thread.title_full: City to begin planting cherry trees in Ballard Park - FOX 8 WVUE New Orleans News, Weather, Sports, Social

author: cbs8
title: City to begin planting cherry trees in Ballard Park
text:
TUPELO, Miss. (AP) - Officials are planning to plant 1,000 cherry trees in Ballard Park to celebrate a peaceful union between Japan and the U.S.
The Northeast Mississippi Daily Journal reports ( http://bit.ly/1LmoEQC ) the first 100 trees will be planted around the park's lake on Oct. 19. The trees are expected to be in full bloom when the North Mississippi Cherry Bloom Festival occurs in the spring.
Public Works is partnering with Tupelo Parks and Recreation and plans to plant 100 trees a year.
In 1912, Japan donated cherry trees to the U.S. to symbolize friendship between the countries.
Director of the city's parks and recreation department Alex Farned says the festival, along with the cherry trees, will be a way to blend cultures.
Information from: Northeast Mississippi Daily Journal, http://djournal.com
